Our People - CFL Skip to content Our Grants Applying for a Grant Available Grants Grant Resources Grants Awarded Set up a Fund Personal Giving Information for Professional Advisers Corporate Giving Lancashire Investors in Community Trust Transfers Helping National Charities Community Benefit Funds Public Sector Funds About Us How We Work Our Impact Our People Our Story Our Policies Annual Reports And Accounts Resources Careers Our News Contact Us Donate Our Grants Applying for a Grant Available Grants Grant Resources Grants Awarded Set up a Fund Personal Giving Information for Professional Advisers Corporate Giving Lancashire Investors in Community Trust Transfers Helping National Charities Community Benefit Funds Public Sector Funds About Us How We Work Our Impact Our People Our Story Our Policies Annual Reports And Accounts Resources Careers Our News Contact Us Our People Home – About Us – Our People Everyone on our team has one thing in common - we are all passionate about growing a stronger community together and helping those most in need across Lancashire. Our Patron Cherie Blair CBE, KC Brought up in Sefton, Cherie became our Patron in 2007, donating her time to passionately promoting the importance of charitable giving to support communities and those most in need. Founder of the Cherie Blair Foundation for Women, she is a leading international human rights lawyer, a passionate campaigner for women’s equality, and wife of former British Prime Minister Tony Blair. Cherie has actively campaigned for human rights and equality for women. She is closely involved with a number of charities around the world with a special emphasis on those working with women, children and the transformative power of education. Our President Amanda Parker Amanda Parker became Lord-Lieutenant of Lancashire in August 2023, and in October of that year it was announced that she would follow on from Lord Shuttleworth as President of the Community Foundation for Lancashire. Amanda, a proud Lancastrian, lives at Browsholme Hall, the Parker family’s estate and the oldest historic family home in Lancashire. She has dedicated her life to serving her community, both in her previous role as a magistrate, and supporting young people through sport, especially hockey, as well as in her role as chair of National Crimebeat, a youth crime prevention charity. Our Trustees David Wareing Solicitor Chair: New Business/Donor Development & Law Find out more Neil Welsh Financial Planner, PM&M Investment LinkedIn Find out more Ruj Dev Chief Financial Officer, Mills & Reeve Treasurer LinkedIn Find out more Sarah Pickerill Head of People, Carpenters Group Human Resources Leadership/Operations LinkedIn Find out more Naz Zaman Chief Officer, Lancashire BME Network Community Leadership/Social Sector & Policy LinkedIn Find out more Donna Howitt Place Strategy Director, Liverpool ONE Marketing & PR LinkedIn Find out more Ram Gupta Managing Director, nybble.co.uk Ltd Organisational Growth & Development LinkedIn Find out more Andy Myers Retired Regional Head, National Lottery Community Fund Community Leadership/Social Sector & Policy Find out more David Wareing I started my career with Hill Dickinson in 1976 and remained with the firm for 45 years. I served as managing Partner and subsequently Senior Partner of what grew into a hugely successful commercial law practice with a turnover in excess of £100m, five offices across the UK, together with four overseas locations. In 2012, the Hill Dickinson Foundation was established, with the support of the Community Foundation, providing support to community-based projects within the UK where Hill Dickinson had a presence. 

I became a Trustee of the Community Foundation for Merseyside in 2016 and was appointed Chair of the Community Foundations for Lancashire and Merseyside in 2022. I very much enjoy cooking (I recently completed a sourdough bread making course) and wine tasting. To work off the excess of food and drink, I am a keen cyclist and skier, and have also developed a passion for long distance walking. I have completed five UK long distance footpaths in the last 4 years. I am a regular concert goer, particularly at the Liverpool Philharmonic Hall, but regrettably have no musical talent of my own! I am however an incurable optimist and accordingly have been a season ticket holder at Everton Football Club for over 50 years! Neil Welsh As financial adviser working for PM+M Financial Planning, based in Blackburn, I service and maintain a bank of around fifty clients supporting their financial planning needs. I joined PM+M in 2015, following a couple of years in small IFA businesses and 25 years before that in banking. Alongside this, I also act in an ambassadorial business development role, representing PM+M within the local business community.

My strong network of connections and experience gained in employed and voluntary roles makes me well-placed to serve the interests of the Community Foundation. A lapsed cyclist I’ve now largely exchanged two wheels for running shoes. Together with partner Helen and daughter Caitlin I represent Ramsbottom Running Club in events up to half marathon, although a full marathon is inevitable. Calories are replaced with nice food, wine and a passion for Belgian beer. Testing my Duolingo progress with French holidays, sunshine and culture helps punctuate the work calendar. I’m a frequent fundraiser for Pendleside Hospice and Burnley FC season ticket-holder alongside son Evan. The sooner the 2023/24 season is over the better! LinkedIn Ruj Dev I joined as Trustee in November 2023, bringing 20 years’ of extensive experience in both the public and private sectors. Having begun my career with Price Waterhouse Coopers, I have since earned recognition as a Fellow Chartered Accountant of the Institute of Chartered Accountants in England and Wales (ICAEW). I have a wealth of experience that includes over eleven years within a number of prominent law firms in the North West. Nature is my sanctuary, whether I’m on a peaceful walk, an adrenaline fuelled challenge, or just relaxing by the shore. My family have always been my rock, grounding me and offering valuable perspective in everything I do. Though I don’t obsess over gym routines, I prioritise staying active for my overall health and well-being. Contributing to causes close to my heart through volunteering or support brings me great joy. I’m always on the lookout for ways to make a positive difference. Travelling fuels my sense of exploration, nourishing both my curiosity and spirit. My actions are always driven by a constant desire to leave a lasting, meaningful impact. LinkedIn Sarah Pickerill I joined the Community Foundation in 2023. I have worked in professional services firms within HR and development departments for over 20 years, including as a HR & Development Director.

I joined Carpenters Group as Head of People in 2020, and am responsible for leading on HR, recruitment, and learning and development, as well as working closely with all teams across the business. My role ensures that Carpenters Group continues to be a fantastic place to work, where people are listened to, innovation is embraced, and people feel valued as they help grow both their own career and the business. Outside my professional work as an HR Director, I am passionate about my family, my caravan in Anglesey and my love of all things running (the order depends on what day it is!). I set up Southport Strollers Running Club in 2018, which is now an all-inclusive England Athletics affiliated club with over 200 members, meeting 3 times a week. I’m proud to have run (mainly slowly) London, Chicago and Berlin marathons, as part of the series of World Major marathon series and excited to take part in the New York marathon in 2024. LinkedIn Naz Zaman I am the current Chief Officer of Lancashire BME Network (LBN), a membership organisation supporting BAME groups and organisations. I have successfully led the organisation through periods of transition and change, most recently around COVID-19 prevention. Prior to my involvement in LBN, I worked across the public and voluntary sectors in a range of roles, including acting as the Equality and Inclusion Lay Member for the East Lancashire Clinical Commissioning Group. 

As well as managing a thriving and continually growing organisation, I sit as a magistrate, and I am also an approved foster carer. Away from work I enjoy spending time with family and friends, going out for food and trying new experiences. I have an interest in crime and psychological thrillers, yes, I know it sounds odd but I have a fascination with human psyche. I also enjoy going away with my husband who loves running marathons abroad, which I’m quite happy to take the credit for. LinkedIn Donna Howitt I joined Liverpool ONE in 2007, a year ahead of opening, in order to establish the Liverpool ONE brand as a household name. I have led on campaigns and initiatives that have breathed excitement and life into a city that is going from strength to strength. Community is at the heart of what Liverpool ONE does and the establishment of the Liverpool ONE Foundation has been fundamental to their care for communities and the people across the city region.  
I bring strong marketing and PR expertise to the table with a genuine passion for the city and wider city region. A self-proclaimed, unofficial taxi driver to two teenage daughters, means my life outside of work is as busy as it is in the office! After a brief stint at ‘back to Netball’, I instead invested time in my daughters love and talent for the game. With both playing weekly all over the North-west for super-league pathway teams, they play above their years for Scotland Netball in the U17’s and U19’s national squads. As a family it has so far taken us to Tobago for the Commonwealth Youth Games, Belfast, Cardiff and to Gibraltar to complete at Netball Europe. When the time allows, I enjoy Pilates, am at my most competitive playing table tennis and at my happiest outdoors, walking my dog, Bob, the cockerpoo! LinkedIn Ram Gupta I come from a humble background, the youngest of four brothers, my professional journey began with a range of jobs that shaped my strong work ethic, including stacking shelves and door-to-door sales. These experiences instilled in me the value of hard work and striving for excellence. Using these values, I became the owner and managing director of nybble.co.uk Ltd, an award-winning IT company providing services globally. Our ethos, “customer is KING,” drives us to deliver exceptional IT, software, and cybersecurity solutions, while maintaining a people-focused approach.

Becoming a Trustee for the Community Foundation for Lancashire and Merseyside (CFLM) was a natural step in my commitment to giving back. Having witnessed the challenges and potential of our local communities, I am dedicated to supporting initiatives that uplift individuals and transform lives. Through my role, I aim to connect resources with impactful projects and foster opportunities for talent to thrive. Outside work, I am involved in various philanthropic and community-driven roles, including serving as a Governor at Blackburn College and supporting causes like Nightsafe and Lancashire Mind. I enjoy playing snooker and pool, and socialising with like-minded individuals. It is an honour to contribute to CFLM’s mission and work alongside others who share a passion for creating positive change. LinkedIn Andy Myers I retired in 2013 after a varied career, my role prior to retirement was with the Big Lottery Fund, one of the distributors of National Lottery money. The Foundations vision, of enriching the lives of people through strategic grant making, matches my passion in respect of the not-for-profit sector. I have seen first-hand, on numerous occasions, how targeted grants to well run and strategically placed organisations can hugely benefit communities, and I wanted to be part of that process going forward. Most people who know me will probably agree that travel is a huge factor in my life. Even before retirement my wife and I fitted in as many holidays as possible. I have been fortunate to travel far and wide and experience the beauty of many different cultures and environments. I am blessed to have a family that makes me smile every day, whether it is the grandsons who keep me feeling young and old at the same time, or my son who still makes me proud when he achieves a PB in his latest running event. My other passions are motorcycle tours around Europe with friends, and supporting Everton FC which is certainly character building. Our Senior Management Team Rae Brooke CEO 0151 294 4757 rae.brooke@cflm.org.uk LinkedIn Find out more Karen Morris Deputy CEO and Development Director 0151 294 4751 karen.morris@cflm.org.uk LinkedIn Find out more Juliet Knight Finance Director 0151 294 4752 juliet.knight@cflm.org.uk Linkedin Find out more James Proctor Programmes Director 0151 294 4754 james.proctor@cflm.org.uk Find out more Rae Brooke As Chief Executive, I have overall responsibility for the strategic development, financial management and performance of the Foundation. I am also responsible for developing and building sustainable relationships with existing and potential donors, community groups, third sector organisations and regional stakeholders. 

I have over 35 years’ senior management experience gained in the private, public and third sectors. During my career I have engaged in market development and business growth initiatives for Littlewoods Pools, Volvo Truck and Bus, Northwest Regional Development Agency, KPMG and Hill Dickinson LLP.
 
I have been involved in the successful delivery of change management initiatives, managed successful teams in the implementation of business development strategies for a broad base of sectors, and influenced and won multimillion-pound investments from overseas multinationals, including US Airways, Bertelsmann, Compal, JP Morgan and Bank of New York.

My career was further enhanced by a secondment to Chicago, targeting high growth technology sectors emerging from the US looking to establish a European base. I worked with regional partners, UKTI and the consulates to attract global inward investment to the North West of England. 

I studied Business and Finance at De Montfort University, CIM Diploma at Salford University and undertook a Harvard Business School Programme for Senior Management Executives. Being from Liverpool and a family of seafarers, I grew up listening to stories of how my father and uncles had sailed the seven seas. Their stories were incredible, colourful and quite often hilarious! So, what I enjoy most is exploring the world and for the past ten years I’ve done that with my daughter, Grace.  Our adventures have been many and varied. On this photo in Hawaii, I’m holding her hand in case any sharks appear with a free hand to punch it on the nose. Apologies to any shark lovers! 0151 294 4757 rae.brooke@cflm.org.uk LinkedIn Karen Morris Having joined in March 2010, I have significant experience in, and responsibility for, leading donor engagement for the Community Foundation. I am responsible for raising the profile of the Community Foundation with a broad audience and cultivating relationships with potential donors -providing them with advice, guidance and solutions for personal and corporate charitable giving. By creating a bespoke package for each of our donors, I support them by connecting them with local causes that match their charitable aims. 

I work with individuals, families, businesses, professional advisers, charitable trusts and the public sector. This includes supporting businesses with ESG and other charitable trusts/trustees to revitalise and manage their charitable giving.

I have over 30 years’ experience in working at a senior level in business engagement, sponsorship and events development and management, and partnership working across the private, public and community sectors in Merseyside, Lancashire, Yorkshire and the North East. Outside work I love my holidays in the sunshine, exploring buzzy cities, and regular trips to the west coast of Ireland. I’m trying to learn to play golf and love a day at the horse-racing, as well as walking Honey, my daughter’s Cavachon. I also enjoy good food, wine, cocktails, dancing, and reading a murder mystery novel or two. 0151 294 4751 karen.morris@cflm.org.uk LinkedIn Juliet Knight I bring a wealth of experience gained from working in the SME sector for over 25 years. After qualifying as a Chartered Accountant, I spent a further five years working in practice before moving into industry. I have very much enjoyed working with a wide variety of small businesses, leading their finance function, including four years as Head of Finance at a local charity and the apprentice training centre North West Training Council.

I have always had a passion for charity work and spent seven years volunteering in my local Barnardo’s shop in Chalfont St Peter before moving to Liverpool in 2005. My absolute passion in life is my dogs – I simply adore small dogs. My partner and I currently have two Norfolk Terriers and a rescue long hair Chihuahua. I enjoy going on cruises and camping, and I’m a keen armchair sports fan, especially watching athletics. I was lucky enough to actually go to Paralympics in London – and was there every single day. I was a bone marrow donor via Anthony Nolan in 2011, and have run the London Marathon for them, which was a real bucket list event. 0151 294 4752 juliet.knight@cflm.org.uk Linkedin James Proctor I lead my team in delivering a range of social investment programmes on behalf of donors and commissioners. Often described as the ‘engine room’, the Programmes Team ensures the effective management of all funds. We are the main point of contact for both donors and community groups, assessing the eligibility of funding applications, completing due diligence, managing the distribution of funds and, importantly, reviewing and reporting on the impact of the projects we support. 

I have been with the Community Foundations since 2008. I previously worked within the legal sector, and I have a LLB (Hons) Law Degree from the University of Central Lancashire. My interests outside of work mainly include losing to my children at a variety of games…they like to make up their own rules! I like to read about history and have a keen interest in astronomy, including watching programmes and listening to podcasts about all things space. I am a passionate Liverpool FC fan, and still hanging on for a season ticket – I’m on the waiting list! I also enjoy watching American football, supporting the Buffalo Bills since 1990 and their 4 Superbowl losses in a row…one day they’ll win! 0151 294 4754 james.proctor@cflm.org.uk Business Development Tim Mitchell Senior Development Manager WH: Mon-Thurs (9am-5pm) & Fri (9am-4pm) 01772440376 tim.mitchell@cflm.org.uk Linkedin Find out more Tim Mitchell I have a wealth of business development experience gained at a senior level in Canadian and UK companies, including Georgeson Shareholder, Computershare and Diageo. 

A key part of my role involves supporting businesses with their charitable giving and working closely with them to achieve their ESG goals, particularly with regards to the social and community element, which the Community Foundation for Lancashire is able to help deliver.

I also focus on growing our Lancashire Investors in Community initiative, of which Edwin Booth CBE, DL, is Ambassador. Artist, cyclist, wine geek, and insufferable car fanatic, I spend my free time pursuing these passions. An artist from the moment I could make marks on paper (or walls) my Mum said I was born with a pencil in hand. My art has always been focused primarily on all things automotive, Porsches and vintage race cars. A marriage of these passions started when I began to learn the art of wine making in 2012 in Napa Valley and now have a passion project creating micro edition wines that are adorned with my automotive artwork. With this, and two kids, the name CHAOS WINE seems to fit… 01772440376 tim.mitchell@cflm.org.uk Linkedin Programmes David Costelloe Programmes Manager WH: Mon-Thurs (9am-5pm) & Fri (9am-4pm) 0151 294 4357 david.costelloe@cflm.org.uk Find out more Kelly Court Programmes Manager WH: Mon-Thurs (9am-5pm) 0151 294 6091 kelly.court@cflm.org.uk LinkedIn Find out more Michaela Kenney Senior Programmes Executive WH: Mon-Weds (8:30am-5pm) Thurs (8am-12pm) 0151 294 4756 Michaela.kenney@cflm.org.uk Linkedin Find out more Ellis Moseley Senior Programmes Executive WH: Mon-Thurs (9am-5pm) & Fri (9am-4pm) 0151 294 4758 ellis.moseley@cflm.org.uk Find out more Amy Norris Programmes Executive WH: Mon-Thurs (9am-5pm) & Fri (9am-4pm) 0151 294 6092 amy.norris@cflm.org.uk LinkedIn Find out more David Costelloe I joined the Community Foundation in 2019, progressing to become a Programmes Manager in 2022. My responsibilities are to manage multiple funding programmes and the distribution of grants throughout Lancashire and Merseyside. The most rewarding element of this work is engaging with charities to both celebrate their successes and to understand the challenges they are seeing in supporting communities. 

Prior to Community Foundation, I worked within relationship management at HSBC Corporate for many years before embarking on a career change to the charitable sector. This saw me volunteer with British Red Cross Refugee Services before taking up a position at Citizens Advice. I hold a First-Class Honours Law degree, and a Master’s degree in International Law and Human Rights from the University of Liverpool. My interests include gigs, tennis, exhibitions, hiking and running, and I take part 5K races right up to 24-hour endurance events. I also volunteer with John Moores Foundation, and at my local Park Run when I can. My top destination would be anywhere Scandinavian, my favourite food is Thai, and I’d say I’m most proud of taking a risk and achieving a complete career change from banking to the charity sector. 0151 294 4357 david.costelloe@cflm.org.uk Kelly Court As Programmes Manager I work with a number of donors and trusts. I joined the Community Foundation in 2004, aged 18, and worked on a youth-led project called YouthBank. I previously worked as a youth worker where I supported a youth group for young people with disabilities. My role is to manage various funds, assessing eligibility of funding applications, distributing funding awards and reviewing the impact of the projects and community organisations that we support. 

Fully trained in using CRM software (Salesforce), I am also a qualified first aider at work. I have also completed a part-time youth work course. I love spending time with my husband, daughter and son. Having fun with family and going on adventures is one of my favourite things, whether it’s going for a walk, holidays, going down to our local beach in New Brighton, or having one of many movie nights at home with the mattresses on the floor. I enjoy spending time with friends, going to concerts and the theatre and reading a good book. I also love VW campervans and would love to buy one and travel around seeing all the sights especially more of Scotland. 0151 294 6091 kelly.court@cflm.org.uk LinkedIn Michaela Kenney I joined the Community Foundation in 2010, managing a project called YouthBank, which engaged local young people in grant-making. In my current role, I am a point of contact for our applicants and offer support and advice where possible. I also assess grant applications, look after some of our smaller funds and support the Programme Managers on larger funds.

Prior to discovering the charity sector, I worked within the finance teams of two local retailers.  I graduated from the University of Central Lancashire in 2009 with a 2:1 Combined Honours degree in Law and Spanish. When the opportunity arises, it’s nice to have a date night here and there, to socialise with friends or to go on a little shopping trip! To relax, I enjoy a good book and a nice cup of coffee. I love spending time with family on day trips, short breaks and holidays or simply playing games, making homemade pizzas, watching Liverpool FC or enjoying film nights at home. 0151 294 4756 Michaela.kenney@cflm.org.uk Linkedin Ellis Moseley I joined the Community Foundation as an Apprentice in 2016. In my current role, I am a key point of contact for our applicants and offer support and advice. I also assess grant applications, manage some of our smaller funds and support the Programme Managers on larger funds.

I have a Business Administration qualification gained through the Liverpool Chamber of Commerce. I joined the Community Foundation for Merseyside as an Apprentice in 2016. In my free time outside of work, I like to play five-a-side football, go for bike rides with my friends in the summer, travel, and I have also recently started playing golf. I like spending time with family and friends, which usually consists of going for food and drinks, especially when Liverpool are playing. 0151 294 4758 ellis.moseley@cflm.org.uk Amy Norris I’m a first point of contact for grant applicants, processing their applications, handling queries, and supporting them. I also ensure we receive grant monitoring forms and proof of expenditure on time.

Before working with the charity, I worked in healthcare recruitment and compliance, which allowed me to build my customer service and data-handling skills. I have always wanted to work somewhere that allowed me to see true change, and be able to help and support those who need it most, which is why I joined the Community Foundation. Born and bred in Liverpool, I try and appreciate the smaller things in life. One of my favourite ways to spend time with those I love is over a homemade meal, meaning I’m always trying new recipes to share with friends, followed by an evening playing a mystery game, or Dungeons and Dragons. I also enjoy the occasional treat trip to the theatre a few times a year, seeing popular and independent productions of wonderful shows. 0151 294 6092 amy.norris@cflm.org.uk LinkedIn Finance Carol Bennett Finance Executive WH: Mon & Fri (8am-4pm) 0151 294 6090 carol.bennett@cflm.org.uk Find out more Sharon Jackson Senior Finance Executive WH: Mon-Thurs (9am-5pm) 0151 294 4753 sharon.jackson@cflm.org.uk Find out more Carol Bennett I am a former civil servant and have followed a career in finance from age 14. I had worked in the retail sector, for Victim Support, and for the voluntary sector before I joined the Community Foundation as a temp in 2009. At that time, I was actively involved in the third sector as a volunteer manager, activity co-ordinator and fundraiser for several small charities. I have now been supporting grass roots organisations for over 35 years and I am the Chair of Merseyside Play Action Council. 

My responsibilities include purchase ledger control and grant payment processing. I am also employed part time as a Finance Administrator at Shrewsbury House Youth & Community Centre in West Everton. I have three grown up children, three grandchildren and two grand-dogs, under 4 years of age, so I am always kept busy either dog or babysitting. My hobbies include knitting, dressmaking, hand craft making. I also enjoy walking in the UK countryside, and have almost completed my personal challenge to walk the British Coastline! I’m a keen hiker and amateur photographer, and as a member of Liverpool Ladies Rebels walking club, I get to enjoy both of my interests at the same time. 0151 294 6090 carol.bennett@cflm.org.uk Sharon Jackson I have always worked in the finance sector, and worked for NatWest Bank for nearly 10 years, from when I was 16 years old. From 1996, I worked in various accounts departments for global insurance companies, and also for insurance brokers, within the Liverpool region until 2020. 

I joined the Community Foundation in 2022. My role is to provide daily support and assistance to the Finance Director, ensuring all funds and income received from donors is allocated correctly and accurately. I also support the operational delivery of the department and support the growth plans. My passion is to travel, and I enjoy holidays in the sun, relaxing on a sun lounger, and reading a good book with a cocktail, or two, to sip on! I have two female Border Collie dogs, Kim and Cassie, and I enjoy nothing better than going on long walks with my husband and our dogs. They certainly get you out in all weathers – rain, hail or shine!  I am a lover of all animals; my absolute favourite animal is the Lowland Western Gorilla; Silverbacks are such majestic beasts. 0151 294 4753 sharon.jackson@cflm.org.uk Marketing and Events Ben Roberts Head of Insights and Communications WH: Mon-Thurs (9am-5pm) & Fri (9am-4pm) ben.roberts@cflm.org.uk LinkedIn Find out more Alayna Navegantes Marketing and Events Executive WH: Mon-Thurs (9am-4:30pm) & Fri (9am-4pm) alayna.navegantes@cflm.org.uk LinkedIn Find out more Ben Roberts ben.roberts@cflm.org.uk LinkedIn Alayna Navegantes As a Marketing and Events Executive, I develop and execute multi-channel strategies that encompass social media, newsletters, graphic design, article writing, press outreach, and event planning. I’m involved in every stage, from concept development and content creation to visual design and campaign execution, ensuring consistent messaging and meaningful audience engagement across all platforms. Originally from Brazil, I have contributed to political and cultural campaigns across the country, where my skills played a key role in achieving successful outcomes for both mayoral and gubernatorial candidates. Since moving to the UK, I have worked with start-ups, leading initiatives in content strategy, social media management, visual design, and media relations. My current role at Community Foundations for Merseyside has given me the opportunity to uncover and share powerful, real-world stories, while also contributing to press engagement to help amplify the impact of community-led initiatives. alayna.navegantes@cflm.org.uk LinkedIn Our Impact We exist to enrich and improve the lives of the people of Lancashire. It’s important we can evidence the impact we have made to all our stakeholders, so we have in place robust processes to enable us to do this. Find out more Our Story Our journey has seen us successfully grow to meet and respond to changing local needs. Read more Our News Check out our latest news, updates and announcements. Read more Who we work with We help many individuals and organisations give to causes that matter to them. Your support matters and we thank each and every one of you. Together we can make a difference. 1892 Foundation Accountancy and advisory firm MHA launched its own North West regional charitable foundation in 2023. The 1892 Foundation funds projects which promote financial literacy and nurture career and life skills for young people. “We’re committed to improving access to financial education to equip the next generation with essential economic skills, something that is not always covered as part of the curriculum in schools. We’ve supported several projects and organisations through the Community Foundation so partnering with them to establish the 1892 Foundation was the natural next step in building on our partnership with this fantastic cause.” Graham Gordon, Regional Chair Read more Consectur dolor amet Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. Ut enim ad minim veniam, quis nostrud exercitation ullamco. Laboris nisi ut aliquip ex ea commodo consequat. Duis aute irure dolor in reprehenderit. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. Read more Consectur dolor amet The BIBAs Foundation was created to develop an enterprising culture in the youth of Lancashire. The Foundation is supported by BAE Systems. It supports projects which enable young people to flourish, learn and develop business skills or knowledge, continue or expand their enterprising work, and build their capacity for the future. “The BIBAs Foundation was established in 2014 by the North and Western Lancashire Chamber of Commerce, with the aim of offering small grants to support young individuals aged between 16 and 24 in pursuing their ambitions and career paths. These grants provide financial assistance to inspire the youth of Lancashire to achieve their goals, whether it be starting their own business, furthering their education, or building their confidence.” Babs Murphy, Chief Executive Read more Blue Sky Foundation The Blue Sky Foundation supports a wide range of projects that promote the health and well-being of children, young people and their families. Christal Foundation Focused specifically on Burnley, the fund aims to help local community groups with delivery of a wide range of projects. The fund is particularly interested in supporting test and learn initiatives – where the funding can help trial projects to build evidence for future scaling up. “The Christal Foundation was set up as an Endowment Fund following my wife’s death. We were both born in Burnley and I wanted to leave a long-term legacy to the town. I hope future funding will make a difference to many local people’s lives.” Read more Consectur dolor amet Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. Ut enim ad minim veniam, quis nostrud exercitation ullamco. Laboris nisi ut aliquip ex ea commodo consequat. Duis aute irure dolor in reprehenderit. “Lorem ipsum dolor amet consectur dolor el dur la amet ipsum lorem ipsum dolor amet le da consectur el.” Name, Company Laboris nisi ut aliquip ex ea commodo consequat. Duis aute irure dolor in reprehenderit. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. Read more Football For Change Football for Change brings together football stars and business leaders with a collective goal to change the lives of young people in some of the most deprived communities in the UK. Launched by football icons including Trent Alexander-Arnold, Jamie Carragher and Conor Coady, Football for Change supports young people by funding life-changing projects in education, employment and sport. Football for Change is investing in young people who face social and economic barriers and aims to support them in achieving their full potential. Read more FPC Foundation Fund Established for over 40 years, Financial Planning Corporation (FPC) is an independent financial planning and wealth management firm. The FPC Foundation supports a range of projects which primarily focus on financial inclusion and supporting people with managing personal finances. “We set up the FPC Foundation so we might extend support, using our resources, expertise, and network, to the communities around us – increasing financial literacy to help enable financial confidence for all, along with other related assistance.” Moira O’shaughnessy, Managing Partner Funding also includes projects which reduce social isolation, encourage more interaction, and provide advice and guidance to people who have become unemployed. Read more Hameldon Hill Wind Farm Community Fund Following the extension of the RWE Wind Farm on Hameldon Hill, a community investment fund was set up to benefit local communities throughout the lifetime of the wind farm (up to 25 years). The fund supports voluntary and community groups, working in the Hapton with Park and Gawthorpe wards of Burnley, which focus on community cohesion, young people and families, promoting education and learning, and the environment. “RWE is proud to support the communities that neighbour our wind farms through our community funds.  It’s great to see the variety of groups and activities that have already benefitted from the fund, which will be available throughout the wind farm’s operational life of up to 25 years.” Kathryn Harries, Community Investment Manager Read more Know Your Neighbourhood Fund The Know Your Neighbourhood Fund is a £14 million programme, which supports nine local authority areas in England. The fund is for activities enabling volunteering and tackling loneliness, with the primary aim of developing and understanding of what works to improve well-being and pride in place in these communities. Funding is provided by the Department for Culture, Media and Sport (DCMS) and delivered locally by the Community Foundation to support charitable organisations working in Blackpool. Read more Lancaster Community Fund The fund was set up following the transfer of several dormant charity funds which had been left to Lancaster City Council in bequests and endowments. The fund has three main priorities, including the promotion of economic growth, health and well-being, and clean, green and safer places.   The fund is currently administrated via Lancaster CVS. Last Choir Singing Community Fund The fund supports the Last Choir Singing competition. The competition aims to showcase musical talent throughout the region. Lancashire primary schools can enter, and the children have an opportunity to sing at various venues across Lancashire with the final being held at King George’s Hall in Blackburn. The competition is the brainchild of businessman George Critchley, who wanted to give something back to the community. “We are very grateful to the Community Foundation for supporting Last Choir Singing. It’s a delight to see the enjoyment the children get from the competition and to see the arts being supported throughout Lancashire.” Jayne Raven, Co-ordinator Read more John Laing Charitable Trust Fund Sir John Laing CBE was a British entrepreneur, philanthropist, and Christian. He inherited his father’s building business (started in 1848) and turned it into one of the UK’s largest construction firms. The John Laing Charitable Trust was set up in 1963 to support current and former employees of the John Laing Group and communities at large. It now supports people in need across the world, focusing on the strategic priorities of community, skills and education, young people and homelessness. “The Trust works hard to make a positive and lasting difference to as many lives as possible through well-researched support and investment at the heart of communities.” Read more Mark McQueen Foundation Fund The Mark McQueen Foundation was established by the family of Mark in loving memory of their son. The fund focuses on supporting mental health, particularly in young men, reducing the incidence of suicide. Read more The Marsden Building Society Charitable Foundation Marsden Building Society was founded in 1860 and has grown to become the largest Lancashire-based building society, placing community at the heart of what they do. The Marsden Building Society Foundation’s priorities include supporting and encouraging financial well-being in the community, creating an inclusive and supportive community through reducing isolation and making Lancashire a great place to be by improving the environment. “Contributing to our communities is something we’re passionate about and the Marsden Building Society Charitable Foundation is a great way for us to do that. Through the Foundation, we’ll be delivering financial support to organisations making a difference in our area.” Rob Pheasey, Chief Executive Read more Pendle Young Musicians Bursary Fund Founded in 2012, the fund’s purpose is to help young people continue their musical studies. The donor, who sadly passed away in 2022, was a concert pianist in their earlier years and their love for music and legacy lives on, inspiring and nurturing the next generation of local musicians. Read more Rossendale Community Fund The Rossendale Community Fund aims to support families and children and young people – helping them to engage in community activities and learning. “The Rossendale Community fund enables our local voluntary, community and faith organisations to provide a variety of positive, diversionary activities for children and young people and add value to their existing services.   Many use the funding to match other external funding and grow the services they offer. Stephanie Thornton, Community Projects & Partnership Team, Rossendale Borough Council.” Read more W O Street Fund Lancashire The W O Street Fund support projects which help to advance education and tackle poverty. The focus is on children and young people who are unable to meet their educational or living costs, and projects for older people, visually impaired or disabled people, particularly those who cannot afford medical or convalescent care. For the past few years, the fund has been a partner of the Community Foundation for Lancashire’s Red Rose Responding Fund. Preston New Road Community Benefit Fund The Preston New Road Community Benefit Fund supports projects which benefit the residents of the Westby with Plumptons parish in Fylde. It priorities projects which help to reduce social isolation, improve community cohesion, or have a positive environmental impact. Red Rose Responding Fund In 2021, the Lancashire Red Rose Responding Fund was established by the Community Foundation for Lancashire in response to an increasing demand for help to support the mental health and well-being of many people, of all ages and backgrounds, particularly those most vulnerable, throughout Lancashire. Initially focusing on the impact of Covid-19 and more recently addressing the pressures of the cost-of-living crisis, our vision is to respond to issues affecting our communities that prevent people from living healthy, fulfilling lives, being able achieve their potential or take up opportunities being created here in Lancashire. Read more The Lancashire Women’s Fund In 2018 the Lancashire Women’s Fund was established by the Community Foundation for Lancashire after our national membership body, UK Community Foundations (UKCF), secured a record £3.4m award from the DCMS Tampon Tax Scheme. We received £70,000 from the allocation to enable us to launch the new Fund, which allowed us to respond to those issues effecting girls and women in Lancashire. The vision of the Lancashire Women’s Fund is to break down the barriers that affect girls and women in the region. The Fred Mill Trust Fund The Fred Mill Fund was created to support a wide range of charitable projects which focus on improving the well-being of the local community – including tackling poverty, hardship, or other disadvantage. The fund supports our Lancashire Women’s fund and also supports projects that help to reduce isolation for older people. Growing stronger communities together. The Community Foundation for Lancashire and the Community Foundation for Merseyside merged in 2014. We work as part of a national network of 47 Community Foundations, providing a strategic and robust grant making service, which contributes to achieving maximum impact in local communities. Visit Community Foundation for Merseyside Get in touch 0330 440 4900 info@cflm.org.uk Stay up to date Get all the latest news from the Community Foundation for Lancashire direct to your inbox. Your details will only be used by us – we will never share your details and you can unsubscribe at any time. Moved to Houston in October 80Graduated Culinary Institute of America. Worked at Cellar in Sky World Trade Center, Sheraton Corporation, Junior League of Houston, Bon Appetite, Lakeside Country Club and Bay Oaks Country Club.Over Thirty years in Food Service13years as a Invited Employee.Team member Texas Chefs Association George W Bush Presidential inauguration reception, Economic Summit Rice University.Culinary Institute of America – Culinary Team Member25 years as a member Houston Livestock Show & Rodeo, Chairman 2 timeWife Tracy, son Gregory, Daughter ElizabethStarted at the Woodlands CC in February Contact Me Jesse Regalado Club Manager | Tournament Contact Me Jesse.Regalado Contact Me + Close Jesse Regalado information modal Jesse Regalado Club Manager | Tournament Serving since 2022 Jesse.Regalado Jesse.Regalado Contact Me Contact Me Amber Sickafoose Membership Director Contact Me 281-845-4886 Amber.Sickafoose Contact Me About Amber + Close Amber Sickafoose information modal Amber Sickafoose Membership Director Serving since 2010 281-845-4886 Amber.Sickafoose 281-845-4886 Amber.Sickafoose Contact Me About Amber Amber holds a BS degree in Marketing from Bellevue University. She started her career as a Director of Marketing for a financial company but quickly decided that sales was her real passion. Her golf career began in 2009 for The Woodlands Country Club as a membership director for both The Oaks and Panther Trail courses as well as The Woodlands Country Club courses. She is a very active member in the community and a graduate of Leadership Montgomery County class of 2013. Contact Me Jason Lippy Membership Director Contact Me 832-810-5876 Jason.Lippy Contact Me About Jason + Close Jason Lippy information modal Jason Lippy Membership Director Serving since 2015 832-810-5876 Jason.Lippy 832-810-5876 Jason.Lippy Contact Me About Jason Jason comes to Indian Wells Country Club by way of Desert Falls Country Club in Palm Desert, where he spent the four years as General Manager / Membership Director. Before moving to California in 2015, Jason spent the previous 12 years working as General Manager / Membership Director for Glen Oaks Country Club, a Invited Affiliate Club in Louisville, Kentucky. 

Jason has worked in the golf business his entire career, starting in the Golf Shop at The Polo Fields Country Club when he was only 16.  He then moved to Glenmary Country Club to join the Membership Sales Department. Eventually becoming Club Manager at Glenmary Country Club.  Jason is a graduate of Western Kentucky University’s Broadcasting Department and has also worked covering college basketball and football for ESPN.  Jason’s interests include playing golf, spending time with his wife and eight year old daughter exploring the Coachella Valley. Contact Me Mitchell Putnam Membership Director Contact Me 832-810-5872 Mitchell.Putnam Contact Me About Mitchell + Close Mitchell Putnam information modal Mitchell Putnam Membership Director Serving since 2014 832-810-5872 Mitchell.Putnam 832-810-5872 Mitchell.Putnam Contact Me About Mitchell Email:  Mitchell.Putnam@clubcorp.comMitchell holds a BS degree in Criminal Justice from Sam Houston State University. He was born and raised in Houston Texas. He joined the Invited family as Service Captain at Willow Creek Golf Club in 2014, eventually becoming the Membership Director in 2017. He joined The Golf Trails of The Woodlands team in 2018 as the Membership Director. He enjoys playing golf, fishing, and watching Houston sports teams play. Contact Me Annemarie McKay Event Sales Director Contact Me 281-801-4103 Annemarie.Mckay Contact Me About Annemarie + Close Annemarie McKay information modal Annemarie McKay Event Sales Director Serving since 2015 281-801-4103 Annemarie.McKay 281-801-4103 Annemarie.McKay Contact Me About Annemarie Annemarie is originally from Allen, Tx. She holds a Bachelor’s degree in Hospitality Administration from Stephen F. Austin State University, located in the small town of Nacogdoches, Texas. Annemarie started her career with Invited as a college intern at Stonebriar Country Club in Frisco, Tx. After she graduated, she was hired on fulltime as their Private Event Coordinator assisting with corporate and social events. Annemarie then moved forward in here career and stepped into the role of Private Event Manager at the Las Colinas Country Club in Irving, Tx. There she continued to build her range of events and added Golf Tournaments to her portfolio. She had the privilege of working on events such as George W. Bush Presidential Center’s Warrior Open and the 2015 Volunteers of America North Texas LPGA Shootout. Annemarie recently moved to Houston to further pursue her passion for private events and is proud to call the Woodlands Country Club home, as their Private Event Director. Contact Me Brooke Tyler Event Sales Director Contact Me 281-339-8085 Brooke.Tyler Contact Me About Brooke + Close Brooke Tyler information modal Brooke Tyler Event Sales Director Serving since 2009 281-339-8085 Brooke.Tyler 281-339-8085 Brooke.Tyler Contact Me About Brooke Brooke Tyler is a graduate of The University of Texas at Arlington with a degree in Public Relations. She moved to the Houston Area in 2004 where she started her career in the hospitality industry. She worked for Marriott International for five years as an Event Manager planning various events ranging from corporate, social, to weddings. She began her career at The Woodlands Country Club in 2009 as an Event Manager where she planned Member Events, Member Association Events and Golf Tournaments. In 2012, she took over the Private Event Manager role where she focused on selling and executing all private events for The Woodlands Country Club. She has had the pleasure of working with many members, clients and brides to successfully implement their event. Some of her most favorite memories have been made at The Country Club. She has made some of her closest friendships while working here, as well as meeting her husband, Wes.
